com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour

Annotation Type FXBehaviour


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=FIELD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface FXBehaviour
    Marks a field with a custom behaviour class - this is the "swiss army knife" for declarative behaviour.
    Author:
    Robert Rohm<r.rohm@aeonium-systems.de>

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends FXAbstractBehaviour> behaviour
      The class of the action.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      FXAbstractBehaviour.Mode assignmentMode
      Whether the behaviour should be added to the existing event handlers or assigned in order to replace them.
      boolean useSharedInstance
      Deprecated. 
      Experimental! Better make the Behaviour implpementation responsible for deciding whether to use a singleton or not. This should then only server for overriding that default. ... but check whether this makes sense at all!

    • Element Detail

      • behaviour

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends FXAbstractBehaviour> behaviour
        The class of the action.
        Returns:
        The action type

      • assignmentMode

        public abstract FXAbstractBehaviour.Mode assignmentMode
        Whether the behaviour should be added to the existing event handlers or assigned in order to replace them.
        Returns:
        The assignement type.
        Default:
        com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.FXAbstractBehaviour.Mode.ASSIGN

      • useSharedInstance

        public abstract boolean useSharedInstance
        Deprecated. Experimental! Better make the Behaviour implpementation responsible for deciding whether to use a singleton or not. This should then only server for overriding that default. ... but check whether this makes sense at all!
        Whether to use a shared behaviour instance for all nodes that use this behaviour.
        Returns:
        Whether to use a shared behaviour instance or create multiple instances.
        Default:
        false
